sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an isosceles triangle.
message_1: In an isosceles triangle, the length of the two equal sides is 8cm each. If the length of the third side is 6cm less than the length of one of the equal sides, what is the length of the third side?
message_2:
The length of the third side is 6cm less than the length of one of the equal sides. Since the equal sides have a length of 8cm each, the length of the third side is:

8cm - 6cm = 2cm

So, the length of the third side is 2cm.
